channel.title: Comments on: UCT MAM1000 lecture notes part 26 – complex numbers part iv

item.title: By: Azhar Rohiman
item.dc:creator: Azhar Rohiman
item.description:
Dr. Shock, I think there is a mistake after you evaluated (3+4i)^17. You used an argument of 0.925 instead of 0.927.
RHMMUH005.
item.content:encoded:
Dr. Shock, I think there is a mistake after you evaluated (3+4i)^17. You used an argument of 0.925 instead of 0.927.

RHMMUH005.

item.title: By: Mathemafrica - UCT MAM1000 lecture notes subject list

item.description: […] MAM1000 lecture notes part 26 – Complex numbers – mod/arg form and multiplication […]
item.content:encoded: […] MAM1000 lecture notes part 26 – Complex numbers – mod/arg form and multiplication […]

item.title: By: Jonathan Shock
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Shock
item.description:
Hey there, you wouldn't get a question like this in a test or exam. You might get a question where you end up with something like 17 pi and would be expected to know that if this is an argument then pi is also an argument, but getting the exact value with numerical coefficients wouldn't be expected. I hope that makes sense.
All the best,
J
item.content:encoded:
Hey there, you wouldn’t get a question like this in a test or exam. You might get a question where you end up with something like 17 pi and would be expected to know that if this is an argument then pi is also an argument, but getting the exact value with numerical coefficients wouldn’t be expected. I hope that makes sense.

All the best,

J

item.title: By: nkosinathi
item.dc:creator: nkosinathi
item.description:
hi dr shock
this is a bit of a delayed reaction, above when we want to calculate the 17th power of the complex number and we reach the point where the angle is 15.764.... in a test situation will we be expected to know the value of 2.pi of will simply leaving in as (15.764...- (n)(2.pi)) be enough. let me know if my question is not so clear and ill try and rephrase.
item.content:encoded:
hi dr shock

this is a bit of a delayed reaction, above when we want to calculate the 17th power of the complex number and we reach the point where the angle is 15.764…. in a test situation will we be expected to know the value of 2.pi of will simply leaving in as (15.764…- (n)(2.pi)) be enough. let me know if my question is not so clear and ill try and rephrase.
